oai_dc:dc.dc:title: W.C. Handy monument at Handy Park, Memphis, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Statue of an African American man, W.C. Handy, holding a trumpet

W. C. (William Christopher) Handy (1873-1958) was an African American blues composer and musician, and widely known as the "Father of the Blues." He is credited with taking blues from a regional style and limited audience in the Mississippi Delta, to a national scale.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Memphis (Tenn.); Handy, W. C. (William Christopher), 1873-1958; W. C. Handy's Memphis Blues Band; City parks
Monuments & memorials; Parks; Blues singer
